alert.note: Alert for Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 10:46PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Osage County through 1115 PM CDT... At 1046 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles east of Reading, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Osage City, Carbondale, Overbrook, Lyndon, Burlingame, Scranton, Melvern Lake and Pomona Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for east central Kansas.
